title: Earl Taft
summary: Earl Jay Taft (1931- Aug. 9, 2021)[1] was an American mathematician specializing in abstract algebra. He is the namesake of the Taft Hopf algebra[2] which he introduced in a 1971 publication,[3] and he was the founding editor of the journal Communications in Algebra.[4] He was Distinguished Professor Emeritus of Mathematics at Rutgers University.[5]
